text.0: enjoy thy fill of meath out of the hotars cup adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him.
text.1: bring it him seeking this he gives granter of wealth drink soma with the Ṛtus from the hotars cup.
text.2: he whom of old i called on him i call on now he is to be invoked his name is he who gives.
text.3: here brought by priests is soma meath granter of wealth drink soma with the Ṛtus from the potars cup.
text.4: fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on lord of the wood unharming strengthen thou thyself.
text.5: drawing and seizing bold one thou who grantest wealth drink soma with the Ṛtus from the neṣṭars cup.
text.6: from hotars cup and potars he hath drunk and joyed the proffered food hath pleased him from the neṣṭars bowl.
text.7: the fourth cup undisturbed immortal let him drink who giveth wealth the cup of the wealthgiving god.
text.8: yoke o ye twain today your herobearing car swiftmoving hitherward your loosingplace is here.
text.9: mix the oblations then come hither with the meath and drink the soma ye rich in abundant strength.
text.10: agni accept the fuel and our offered gift accept the prayer of man accept our eulogy.
text.11: do thou with all with Ṛtu o thou excellent fain make the great gods all fain taste the gift we bring.
